get.description: This endpoint allows users to search for and return a page of campaigns based on various query parameters. Users can filter by name, sort, and paginate through the campaigns, as well as control which properties are returned in the response.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

post.description: Create a campaign with the given properties and return the campaign object, including the campaignGuid and created properties.

This endpoint deletes a batch of campaigns. 
The maximum number of items in a batch request is 50.
The response will always be 204 No Content, regardless of whether the campaigns exist or not, whether they were successfully deleted or not, or if only some of the campaigns in the batch were deleted.

This endpoint creates a batch of campaigns. The maximum number of items in a batch request is 50.
The campaigns in the response are not guaranteed to be in the same order as they were provided in the request.

This endpoint reads a batch of campaigns based on the provided input data and returns the campaigns along with their associated assets. 
The maximum number of items in a batch request is 50.
The campaigns in the response are not guaranteed to be in the same order as they were provided in the request.
If duplicate campaign IDs are provided in the request, duplicates will be ignored. The response will include only unique IDs and will be returned without duplicates.

This endpoint updates a batch of campaigns based on the provided input data.
The maximum number of items in a batch request is 50.
If an empty string ("") is passed for any property in the Batch Update, it will reset that property's value.

get.description: Get a campaign identified by a specific campaignGuid with the given properties. Along with the campaign information, it also returns information about assets. Depending on the query parameters used, this can also be used to return information about the corresponding assets' metrics. Metrics are available only if startDate and endDate are provided.

delete.description:
Delete a specified campaign from the system.
This call will return a 204 No Content response regardless of whether the campaignGuid provided corresponds to an existing campaign or not.

patch.description:
Perform a partial update of a campaign identified by the specified campaignGuid. Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will cause 400 error.
If an empty string is passed for any property in the Batch Update, it will reset that property's value.

get.description:
This endpoint lists all assets of the campaign by asset type. The assetType parameter is required, and each request can only fetch assets of a single type.
Asset metrics can also be fetched along with the assets; they are available only if start and end dates are provided.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

put.description:
Associate a specified asset with a campaign. Using the API, you can create associations for the following asset types: ads, blog posts, calls, case studies, CTAs, CTAs (legacy), external website pages, feedback surveys, forms, files, knowledge base articles, landing pages, marketing email, marketing events, meetings, playbooks, podcast episodes, sales documents, sales emails, sequences, SMS, social posts, static lists, videos, website pages, and workflows.

For other asset types, it is recommended to manage your associations directly in the campaign tool in HubSpot.

delete.description:
Disassociate a specified asset from a campaign. Using the API, you can remove associations for the following asset types: ads, blog posts, calls, case studies, CTAs, CTAs (legacy), external website pages, feedback surveys, forms, files, knowledge base articles, landing pages, marketing email, marketing events, meetings, playbooks, podcast episodes, sales documents, sales emails, sequences, SMS, social posts, static lists, videos, website pages, and workflows.

For other asset types, it is recommended to manage your associations directly in the campaign tool in HubSpot.

post.description: Add a new budget item to the campaign

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about the budget and spend items for a specified campaign, including the total budget, total spend, and remaining budget.
Budget and Spend items may be returned in any order, but the order field specifies their sequence based on the creation date. The item with order 0 is the oldest, and items with higher order values are newer
Get a specific budget item by ID

put.description: Update a specific budget item by ID

delete.description: Delete a specific budget item by ID

get.description: Fetch the list of contact IDs for the specified campaign and contact type

parameters.name: campaignGuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the campaign

parameters.name: contactType
parameters.description: The type of contact to filter the list

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

get.description: This endpoint retrieves key attribution metrics for a specified campaign, such as sessions, new contacts, and influenced contacts.

parameters.name: campaignGuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the campaign

get.description: Fetch revenue attribution report data for a specified campaign

parameters.name: campaignGuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the campaign

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date to fetch attribution data, YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date to fetch attribution data, YYYY-MM-DD

post.description: Create a new campaign spend item

get.description: Read a campaign spend item by its spendId

put.description: Update a specific campaign spend item by ID

delete.description: Delete a specific campaign spend item by ID

category.description: The main category of the error.

context.description: Additional context-specific information related to the error.

id.description: A unique ID for the error instance.

links.description: URLs linking to documentation or resources associated with the error.

message.description: A human-readable string describing the error and possible remediation steps.

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

subCategory.description: A more specific error category within each main category.

id.description: The unique identifier for the campaign to be updated.

properties.description: A set of key-value pairs representing the properties to be updated for the campaign.

startedAt.description: The date and time when the batch operation began.

status.description: The current status of the batch operation. Accepted values are: CANCELED, COMPLETE, PENDING, PROCESSING.

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

amount.description: The monetary value associated with the spend item.

createdAt.description: The timestamp indicating when the spend item was created.

description.description: A detailed explanation or notes about the spend item.

id.description: Unique identifier for the spend item.

name.description: The name assigned to the spend item.

order.description: The sequence order of the spend item, where 0 is the oldest.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp indicating when the spend item was last updated.

completedAt.description: The date and time when the batch operation was completed, formatted as a date-time string.

links.description: A map of related links associated with the batch operation.

requestedAt.description: The date and time when the batch operation was requested, formatted as a date-time string.

startedAt.description: The date and time when the batch operation started, formatted as a date-time string.

status.description: The current status of the batch operation, with possible values: CANCELED, COMPLETE, PENDING, PROCESSING.

assets.description: Contains the assets associated with the campaign, each represented as a collection of campaign assets.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the campaign was created, formatted as a date-time string.

id.description: The unique identifier for the campaign.

properties.description: A map of key-value pairs representing the properties of the campaign.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the campaign was last updated, formatted as a date-time string.

budgetTotal.description: The total budget allocated for the campaign.

currencyCode.description: The currency code used for the budget and spend amounts, following ISO 4217 standards.

remainingBudget.description: The remaining budget available for the campaign after accounting for all spend items.

spendTotal.description: The total amount spent across all spend items in the campaign.

id.description: The unique identifier for the campaign to be deleted.

amount.description: The monetary value of the spend item.

description.description: A brief description of the spend item.

name.description: The name of the spend item.

order.description: The sequence number indicating the order of the spend item.

properties.description: A collection of key-value pairs representing the properties of the campaign. Each key is a property name, and the corresponding value is the property's value.

influencedContacts.description: The number of contacts influenced by the campaign.

newContactsFirstTouch.description: The number of new contacts attributed to the campaign as the first touchpoint.

newContactsLastTouch.description: The number of new contacts attributed to the campaign as the last touchpoint.

sessions.description: The total number of sessions generated by the campaign.

amount.description: The monetary amount allocated for the budget item.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the budget item was created.

description.description: A description of the budget item.

id.description: The unique identifier for the budget item.

name.description: The name of the budget item.

order.description: The order of the budget item, indicating its sequence based on creation date.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the budget item was last updated.

total.description: The total number of campaigns available.

amount.description: The monetary value assigned to the budget item.

description.description: A detailed explanation or notes about the budget item.

name.description: The name of the budget item.

order.description: The sequence number indicating the order of the budget item.

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

id.description: The unique identifier for the campaign asset.

metrics.description: A collection of metrics associated with the campaign asset, represented as key-value pairs.

name.description: The name of the campaign asset.

contactsNumber.description: The number of contacts attributed to the campaign.

currencyCode.description: The currency code used for the revenue attribution, with accepted values including AED, AFN, ALL, and others.

dealAmount.description: The total amount of deals attributed to the campaign.

dealsNumber.description: The number of deals attributed to the campaign.

revenueAmount.description: The total revenue amount attributed to the campaign.

before.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving previous pages.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the previous pages' results.

PreviousPage.description: specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the previous set of results in a paginated API response

id.description: The unique identifier for the business unit, represented as an integer.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the next page results.

NextPage.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response

createdAt.description: The date and time when the campaign was created, formatted as a date-time string.

id.description: The unique identifier for the campaign.

properties.description: A collection of key-value pairs representing additional properties of the campaign.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the campaign was last updated, formatted as a date-time string.
